text.p: These are the leading stories in the Lebanese press on Friday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- A five-nation group monitoring the ceasefire in Lebanon said Israel violated the U.S. brokered April 26, 1996, ceasefire understanding by placing bombs that killed civilians in south Lebanon.
- Lebanon will face the the Israeli occupation as well as the challenge of reconstruction whatever the difficulties, Prime Minister Hariri said.

- Minister of Displaced People Jumblatt said: "The Pope and the Vatican state have rightist antecedents, they helped military dictatorships in Salvador and Brazil and even in Poland he fought against the Communist regime".
- About 18,000 soldiers will maintain security during the Pope's weekend visit to Lebanon, Minister of Interior Murr said.
- The pro-Iranian Hizbollah wished the Pope a successful visit to Lebanon.
- Christian opposition mandated Maronite Patriarch Sfeir to explain to Pope its views on the Lebanese situation.
- Israel shells central sector of south Lebanon.
- The U.N.'s Economic and Social Commission for Western Asia ended two-day meeting in Beirut.
